intro: Sogerianthe, commonly known as the "sogeri" plant, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and oval-shaped leaves. Sogerianthe typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
